text:
I am very pleasantly surprised by how nice Oakwood Premier Cozmo Serviced Apartments are.
On my many trips to Jakarta I stayed either in the hotels across the street (Ritz-Carlton and JW Mariott) or in the city center, only to realize now that there was a real gem right under my nose! At a very decent price!

The apartments are very stylish, well furnished and modern. Very clean and fresh. 
This is where you have comfort of a hotel (bath robes, bathroom amenities, fresh towels, daily room service) and convenience of a home (microwave, cooking stove and oven, big fridge, all necessary kitchen utensils, washing machine).
Sufficient lighting in all rooms, such a huge plus for me! 

The stuff are great, all of them - reception, security, housekeepers. All my requests were met with a warm smile and perfect execution. They make an effort to make you feel welcome and taken care of. 
Housekeeper Marianna left my unfinished lunch on the table with a note explaining that she didn't clean it in case I wanted to finish it later, but if I need it cleaned she's a phone call away. How nice is that! That sweet little note made me feel right at home, almost like my mom was there taking care of me :)   
It is especially convenient to have a grocery store, a pharmacy and Starbucks in the same building. SOS International Clinic is a 2-minute walk away. There is some shopping and restaurants within walking distance. 
I haven't had enough time to check all their facilities. I know there are a gym and a pool. I'm not sure there is a SPA. Wouldn't hurt to have one ;-)  

I highly recommend this place. If I ever have to stay in Mega Kuningan district of Jakarta, Oakwood Premier Cozmo Apartments will be my only choice!
title: What a pleasant surprise!

photos.caption: Living Room (sorry for a dark pic)

text:
I stayed here for 3 nights and loved this place very much. I had a single room deluxe accomodation, which is really a small serviced residence with a single bedroom, a living + dining area and a bathroom.

The room is well appointed - there is a dining area with kitchen facilities, next to which is a living area which has plush furnishing. The bedroom has a comfortable bed, a small work table, and built in wardrobe, and another smaller TV inside. The bathroom featues the standard toilet + shower design - but includes a washing machine + dryer as well.

The layout of the room makes this feel more like a home rather than a hotel or serviced residence, and it has a very nice ambience to it. I wouldn't mind staying longer in this place at all.

The staff were mostly very courteous, always helpful and very obliging, which is great too. My check in was withou fuss, as was my checkout.

They serve a small, but good breakfast selection, and there is a smallish gym and swimming pool. In terms of facilities, this place doesn't lack anything at all.

At the bottom of the residence complex are a number of eating places - so it's also very convenient - you have a choice of food, and there's a small grocer as well for your daily needs. In other words, you can really stay here for a few days, and not have to leave the complex.

Overall, I rate this service residence very highly. I think this place should be highly recommended for long term stays, and even for shorter term ones to Jakarta, especially if you need to be around the Kuningan or Setiabudi areas downtown.
title: Great accomodation - value for money!

text: The panoramic views from the apartment are out-of-this-world! The staff are professional and more than friendly. Kids had a great time in the pristine kids playroom and the infinity pool is a great place to relax. It's location next to a supermarket is very convenient for families. My son lost the toy he'd bought at the store next door and the staff, without hesitation, offered to buy him a new one. We really felt right at home.
title: Fantastic staff, magnificent views

text:
The location of the property is absolutely magnificent. It is right in the middle of the best area in Jakarta. Close to many embassies, shopping center, great restaurant etc... 
The property is very clean with cleanign staff are very friendly and efficient.
However, the security staff of this property is terrible. They do complete body search to their own customers, including opening your bags without permission. I saw 5 years old children being searched! it is ridiculous.

These people need to stop being stupid in the name of security.
title: great facility, lousy staff

text:
Nice apartment hotel in a good location in Jakarta, right opposite the JW Marriott. Very comfortable apartments, good breakfast and business facilities.

Great value for money. All amenities needed either in the hotel or in the same building - restaurants, shops, bars etc.
title: Great business and leisure apartment hotel

text:
I have now stayed at Oakwood five times, and each time I have been more than happy with both the rooms and the service.
The check-in procedure is smooth and the staff speaks excellent English.
The rooms are spacious and clean with good water pressure in the shower. The washing machines are also very useful and the hotel supplies washing powder.
Housekeeping is efficient and if you have put the do not disturb sign  out, they will not contact you until 15:00 where they will call you and ask if you want room service.
Yesterday evening I needed a measuring tape, and within 5 min. they had one I could borrow.
On a previous visit I had forgotten a pillow, that they then kept in storage until my next visit.
I can only recommend Oakwood, they make me feel at home whenever I visit Jakarta.
title: Excellent apartments and service

text:
Comfortable and  homy at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta (OPCJ)

Yes, we were back at the Oakwood PCJ. 
This time it was for our mother's birthday staycation.
It was such a fun stay. 
We are a big family and we all liked staying at the OPCJ.

My family checked in first on the 18th December 2022 in unit #2603. A lovely appartment with a beautiful view and surroundings. We stayed there for 1 night only as the next day we have booked other larger units for our big family, namely in #2505 & #2506.
Our move to #2505 was made easy and perfectly done by  housekeeping staffs Bagas & Danu, whilst our luggages were transported by Santiko from the reception.

Needless to say, the units we booked were requested by our  family because of our unforgettable previous stay there. It was a favourite since we like  the big dining table and spacious living room.

Our stay there from the 18th to 23rd December 2022 was enjoyable, comfortable and memorable. 
We used the gym and pool for our entertaiments.

We also had the opportunity to have  breakfast at the Oakroom during our stay. The buffet was endless with so many delectable choices. Thank you to Asri & Agnes for the wonderful service given.

At one time, there was a minor defect with our handheld shower head in #2505 and was promptly and  courteously  fixed by engineer, Siswoyo.

Our room was also always in clean and neat condition, thanks to Ibu Rina with her housekeeping team, Khansa, Radit, Ade, Rengga  & Anggita, who  always make us feel pleasant and at home. All our needs attended to politely and swiftly.

Checking out on the 23rd was smooth sailing. It was done in a fast yet precise manner. Grateful for the help rendered by Meta, Fajar and the bellman (blue polo shirt, unfortunately did not get his name).

Thank you once again, Oakwood.
You have made us feel special, starting from our reservation handled by Rizty, up  to our speedy check out.
 We had a blast staying there. 

Keep up the good work Oakwood team. 
For sure we will be back again soon.
title: Comfortable and  homy at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta (OPCJ)

text:
A mix feeling of this hotel. 

There are pros and cons. 

Pros: 
1, We were staying at a 3 bedroom suite. The decor was modern and cozy. It’s also spotless clean.

2, Breakfast - wide variety 

3, nice swimming pool -  perfect for both leisure swimmer and lap swimmer

Cons
1, Service really put us off. One of my family members accidentally broke a tumbler glass. We thought that’s just a small issue as tumbler glass is consumable product anyway. When we got back the room, we received a letter from hotel asking us to compensate 75,000 IDR for the tumbler glass without asking if we got hurt by breaking the glasses. We were totally fine to pay and thought we would settle this when we checked out. After an hour, we got an email from the hotel reminding us to pay 75,000 IDR. We also got a voice message asking the compensation. On our last day, after having breakfast, we went back to the room but we couldn’t access the room by any of our room keys. The room was locked. We went to the front desk. The front desk staff asked about the broken glasses and 75,000 IDR again. I asked if that was the reason they locked the room. The front desk staff said we never replied their email about this incident. We were totally shocked and appalled. The hotel held a credit card deposit. I don’t understand why the hotel locked the door and didn’t allow us to access the room.
title: Bad service

owner_response.text:
Dear Uglyswan,

Thank you for your review and compliments on our breakfast variety, interior, and facilities. We appreciate the time you have taken to give us some feedback. 

We have noticed your concern with regard to the replacement charge for the tumbler glass and key access to your room. We have investigated with the relevant department that our associate has reported the tumbler glass in your apartment unit is broken. Based on our rules and regulations, it is stated in the event of missing or damaged items that are kept inside the apartment or property, they are chargeable. The rules and regulations are given to all guests and signed upon check-in. It is a common policy for hotels to require a security deposit or incidental charge upon check-in. The amount will be returned upon check-out if you did not incur any extra charges during your stay. This deposit can be paid in cash or by pre-authorization with a credit card. 

We noticed from the record that you approached our front office associate on your last stay regarding key access to your room because two of your room keys were not working. Our front office associate gave you another set of keys so you can access your room again.

Once again, we appreciate your feedback and thank you for staying with us. At Oakwood, we work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience and make everyone feel at home. Thank you for choosing Oakwood as your preferred accommodation in Jakarta. We hope to see you again very soon.


Sincerely,

Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta

We stayed here from 25 until 27 of June and we had the one bedroom suite. We really love the room as it was clean and sanitized properly. The room had complete amenities we could hope for: a large refrigerator, stove, microwave, kitchen utensils, we even love the counter top that we used as dining table. The bathroom was good, it has rainfall shower with hot water but unfortunately there was no bathtub. The TV in the bedroom is a bit too small, we were hoping for a bigger one.
The breakfast was good although not many options on the buffet but they tasted good. Location is superb, just go downstairs to get to a supermarket and many restaurants nearby.
Overall it was a great stay. Great aparthotel with great service, wonderful staff, great location. Will be back again for sure.

text:
I had read good reviews about the Oakwood hotel chain and hence decided to stay at Oakwood Premier Cozmo in Jakarta when I was here for my business trip. However, I was totally disappointed with the experience I had during my stay.

Firstly, it seems that the hotel has not been able to enforce their "so-called" COVID-19 safety protocols. There were times that I saw other guests not wearing mask in the lift or even at the main lobby, which was just in front of the reception counter! 

Secondly, although I was staying on a non-smoking floor because I have bad allergy to cigarette smoke, I could always detect cigarette smoke smell in my apartment. Despite highlighting to the hotel staff, they were unable to stop this from happening. They would always give excuses that they had checked and would continue to monitor, but the cigarette smoke smell kept going to my apartment. I ended up having bad respiratory symptoms during my stay.

The staff would always give empty promises and the issues remain unsolved.

I really hope that Oakwood, being such a well-known international brand in the hospitality sector can do more to make sure that all their hotels uphold the good quality and standard everywhere in the world. I also hope the above feedback can help Oakwood Premier Cozmo in Jakarta to be a better place to live in and greater experience for their guests.
title: Bad Experience!

owner_response.text:
Dear Lee D,

Thank you for taking time to share your feedback with us. 

At Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta, we pride ourselves on creating a stay experience that is built on service excellence and the familiar comfort and safety of home, especially for extended stays. 

Amidst the current global health situation, we remain committed to protecting the health, safety and well-being of our guests and associates. With this commitment in mind, Oakwood is one of the first hospitality companies in Jakarta to identify the existing health threat, and has in place a robust global hygiene programme – Oakwood Clean360, that encompasses enhanced operational standards of safety across all properties. One key measure is the mandatory use of face coverings while in public areas on property. Whilst this measure is not mandated by local authorities, our associates seek to ensure this is adhered to at our property, and if in the event guests do not have a mask with them, one would be provided for use. I would like to assure you that the team takes this precautionary measure very seriously and repeated non-compliance would lead to cessation of stay.

We recognise also, that our guests may have different preferences when embarking on extended stay arrangements with us. Thus, in ensuring that we provide our guests with a most comfortable stay, the property has clearly designated strict smoking and non-smoking levels for all Oakwood Premier-branded units. As this development is built on a model of mixed-ownership, and we are of the understanding that your unit is not managed by Oakwood Premier, we will next assist to reiterate the issues you have highlighted to the Building Management team, so that they may reach out to you to explore measures that will help improve your stay. 

Granting access to your apartment by a team of Building Management and Oakwood Technicians could potentially solve some of the issues outlined.

Thank you.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Our family hasn't had a travelling or go for holiday since this pandemic. owner_response.text:
Dear CThamamongood, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. 

We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. 

From our records I can see that on 04./03/20 at 07.47am, that you requested to change all pillow cases, bed sheets and duvet cover with new ones, due to their smell. 

Similarly on 05/03/20 at 08.00 am, you again requested to change bed linen, due to a sweat smell. The House keeping attendant this time changed not only the linen but also the duvet and 4 pillows themselves. 

We apologise for this inconvenience and can assure you we are vigilant in detecting unusual aromas on the clean linen and rejecting them before moving them to the guest floors. 

If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, I can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great Oakwood experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of. 

Sincerely, 

M Hines 
General Manager

text: Perfect, as always. Every time in Jakarta - always choose Oakwood. Excellent in everything you may consider! Great breakfasts for almost any choice. Swiming pool is 30 meters long - great for sports or recreational swimming.

owner_response.text:
Dear Global44104109738,

We appreciate your feedback, it is most appreciated.

And.... you have hit on a subject which has not been raised previously..... The Oakwood Premier swimming pool is, in fact, 25m long by 7 m wide and an impressive 1.7m deep which allows recreational swimmers to enjoy it, but serious exercise swimmers to put in some hot laps and do tumble turns.

For the children we have a sizeable Kids Pool which is 9.8m long by 7 m at a depth of 70cm. CCTV cameras watch over the pool areas.

After enjoying your swim I hope you relaxed in the adjoining outdoor Jacuzzi  which has a 7m diameter and a luxurious 1 metre depth. Or perhaps, sought refuge from the sun under the canopy of the "Upper Deck" area where one can chill and while away the hours with your kindle or other device... or perhaps, sip gently on one of the Bar's Cocktails/ Mocktails!

We look forward to seeing you again at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta

Sincerely yours

M Hines
General Manager

Dear Scenic52705450020,

I have worked in the hospitality industry for many years and my family vacations with my, at that time, young family bring back memories of everyone cramming into one bedroom with extra bed and not enough space. I wish I had known about Serviced Apartments; because, for me, they are an ideal solution to a family's leisure accommodation needs.

As you correctly point out, the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta has spacious apartments, fully kitted out kitchens, along with wifi, multi channel TV. Prepare a meal, have your favourite fast food delivered or opt for the dishes from the In-Room Dining menu. Relax by the lovely pool with Children's Pool and Jacuzzi attached; or venture out into Mega Kuningan and enjoy one of many restaurants and close by shopping malls, cinemas or themed bars.

Thank you for your review, it is most appreciated.

Kind regards
M Hines
General Manager

owner_response.text:
Dear Seeker,

Many thanks for your review; your time spent is much appreciated.

The growth of Mega Kuningan over the last few years has seen an influx of restaurants / bars which now include 

*     a Belgian/french inspired brasserie
*     Spanish Tapas
*     Well regarded Indian restaurant
*     A Malaysian / Asian restaurant
*     An internationally recognised SteakHouse
*     A tasty Grill House
*     Fish/Seafood Speciality restaurant and bar
*     An Italian restaurant with a great reputation

.....not to mention a plethora of other choices in the Lotte Shopping Mall - a leisurely 10 minute stroll from the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta.

And don't forget Oakwood has its own restaurant and bar which also facilitates In-Room Dining if you want to simply chill and watch your favourite movie or Netflix offering.

Once again, thanks for your input and look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Kind regards

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
When it comes to serviced apartments in Asia, Oakwood is a name you can trust to always offer quality and service, and this is so true for the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta.

Although it is one of the best serviced apartments in Jakarta and there are a lot of good, there are a few bads. Let us take a look at the Goods and Bads:

The Good:

- the apartments are spacious and the décor is magnificent. 

- the breakfast lounge is spectacular and the food and service are great.

- the staff are very friendly and truly helpful. They did something for me that truly amazed me; I did not like the shower head in my bathroom, so I bought a new shower head, went to the reception and asked if they could change the shower head and that I bought a new one, they said they will be glad to change it and asked when I want it to be changed, told them ASAP, and they changed it within an hour and on a Sunday! WOW.

- The location is really good. You are just minutes away, walking distance, from two really good malls (Lotte Shopping Avenue and Kuningan City Mall). Also, right at the gate and on the same building you have a Starbucks, a Mini mart, and a few restaurants. 

- There are a lot of spaces to put your stuff in, a lot of closets, a lot of drawers, even hidden drawers under the bed, and work desk with (again) a lot of drawers. I just love that I have a lot of space to put everything in and still have a lot of free space. 

The Bad:

- Sound insulation is not that good !! we had a few sleepless nights where other tenants in apartments next to or above or under our apartment were having a party or something and the noise was unbearable, and it continued to the hours of dawn !!

- we had a small flies infestation in the apartment for the length of our stay !!

- on several days, the smell of cocking carried out through the AC from other apartments to our master bedroom, and sometimes it was so strong (especially when garlic was involved) and so early in the morning that we could not sleep. To be fair, I told the reception about the problem and they offered to move us to another apartment, but that was inconvenient because all our stuff was already unpacked.

The Bad for Me (might not be for others):

- I stayed in the three Bedroom apartment, with my family of five. Usually the third bedroom will have two single beds, but here they have a queen bed in the second and third rooms, and they can’t change that !! It really make more sense to have one room in the three bedroom apartment with two single beds.

- I love my privacy, specially in the bathroom, and I did not get that in the master bedroom bathroom with the tainted glass door with a gap in between !! Solid Wood Door PLEASE.

That’s it, the good, the bad, but certainly no Ugly in the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta.

.Peace.
title: Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta – One of the best

text: The common areas , doors need to be repainted and in some cases, the doors need to be replaced . The whole property , rooms and common areas look and feel jaded . Food quality has also dropped .Were it not for the convenience of the location , I would not stay at the Oakwood .
title: Time to refurbish
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan hotel ini

text:
It is time to visit back in Jakarta City for 4 nights for business and pleasure.  This time we decided to stay in Oakwood Premiere Cozmo Jakarta.  A serviced apartment in Mega Kuningan complex where you can find many offices buildings, five star hotels such JW Marriot and Ritz Carlton and quality restaurants at the heart of business area of Jakarta.  We got the One-Bedroom Executive Apartment which has a separate study room or working space which has a sofa-bed that can be transformed to a room for our 2 children (age 10 and 4.5 years old).  With total area of 100m2, separate kitchen from living room and dinning room makes my little family enjoy their four night stays very comfortably in hustling and buzzing of Jakarta.

It really amazed me (until now) was it still gave me the same feeling as the first time I visit a decade ago.  It is an upscale place with a friendly business atmosphere.  And what really amazed me as  I sat in the sofa lobby and exhaling its ambiance with an awe was how well they maintained the place. It was the same set up, same furniture and the same decorations as ten years ago. But they are still looked brand new and shinning.  The same smiles and friendly greetings applied welcoming us that day. The quality of cleanliness is as par as those current five stars hotels.  All those qualities consistently continue to our bedroom which located at 23rd floor.  When we entered our room all separate controlled aircondition were on to make us comfortable. A small but equipped kitchen and a wash and drier washing machine really made our stay there feels like home.  We did not have to try hard to entertain our kids daily.  As the swimming pool and small kids room are available for them to use.  The only restaurant where breakfast buffet is available every morning also on the 3rd floor.  Talking about restaurant, it is not lack of good restaurant on the surround buildings but my favourite is located just at the upper ground of the building called “Penang Bistro”.  It is a stylish Malayan restaurant which the food make me want to come for more and more.  A very good and complete supermarket also can be find at the Ground floor of the building which is so useful if you are traveling as a family. A very popular Bar-Restaurant called “Loewey” positioned at its Ground floor too.  Makes you do not need to go anywhere for good cocktail and bar ambiance.

At the moment it is my favourite service apartment to stay in Jakarta.  With the reason of quality of product, service and where it is located at a very convenient place for either business or pleasure in Jakarta.  The ambiance is suited me perfectly, never felt overcrowded.  I feel always save with a good security, always check on any visitors coming but never fail to give the feeling that we are welcome there.
title: Amazing way they have maintained the great standard for 10 years

text: A good location in Jakarta; and good choice of eating places nearby.  Lotte shopping center at Ciputra World within 10 minutes walking distance.  Well-managed property.  Room accommodation is excellent.  Customer-oriented service personnel.

text:
I stayed here with my daughter in June for 4 nights. Previously I did do a review in which I have deleted as I feel like I may have jumped the gun a bit. I had a bad incident on the first night which shouldn't reflect the fact that the hotel and room itself was really 5 stars. The rooms are massive with separate TV/sitting area and kitchen. The shower in the bathroom is awesome but pity there is no bath tub. There is however a very nice pool area with sun lounges. 

I really liked the fact we were so close to all the shopping, Ambassador Mall and Kota Kasablanca is literally minutes away.

There's also a supermarket, starbucks, chemist and other little shops right next door practically in the same building. The security and staff here are super friendly and by the last day my daughter was already asking me "when can we come back" 

Buffet Breakfast was also good value and I looked forward to my morning cappuccinos.

If you are staying at this hotel and have any issues then I suggest to talk to staff and management as they take your concerns seriously and that's what I like about this place. You're not just another number, they try to make you feel like part of the family. 

Thanks to all the staff at Oakwood, we will be back in December hopefully.
title: A Change of Mind

text:
I transitted in Jakarta for 2 days for my next holiday. I asked help for the laundry. They said the laundry was normally delivered @7 pm the next day. I asked to be delivered around 6 - 6.30 pm and they asked for double price. It is just 1/2 - 1 hour earlier. My laundry was as much as 40 sets (shirt + pant) plus underware and socks. Can you imagine how much the total cost would be?

The Assistant Manager, Ayom Prasetyo even told me to do the laundry myself using the washing machine in the apartment. 40 sets in 1 night? Is that how you served your guest?

I travelled in so many countries and staying in so many hotels, this is the first time happened to me in my own country.
title: Staff are not helpful

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta. It is obviously our goal to satisfy the needs and expectations of our clients and I am sorry that in this particular case we have failed. 

In the interests of our property I do however feel it necessary to address your comments.

1.	Prior to arrival you advised us of your laundry requests whereby you wanted your laundry collected at 3.00pm and returned by 6.00pm the next day. We explained to you that we use an outside laundry provider and we would check with them. We contacted the laundry provider on your behalf to see if they could meet your requests. The laundry provider informed us that for items deposited at 3.00pm the earliest that they could do was to return them by 7.00pm the next day. They could not guarantee earlier delivery. You seemed unwilling to accept their reply.    
2.	You subsequently informed us that you would not arrive at 3.00pm but at 6.00pm. Again we informed you that since you were now arriving three hours later than originally planned our laundry provider definitely cannot return your laundry by 6.00pm the next day. 
3.	In order to satisfy your requirements we offered you a number of alternative laundry options to ensure that your laundry would be returned within your required time frame. Initially you thanked us for sending you these options. You subsequently rejected them all as being too expensive. You said that you are only willing to pay for a regular laundry service not an express service. I would point out that paying for express laundry services is standard practice in five star properties.  
4.	You requested us to provide you with contact details of other local laundry options close to our property which we duly did.  

I would point out that other comments on Trip Advisor constantly make reference to the high standard of service delivered by our property. I also note that all your comments on Trip Advisor (6 in total) are all negative.  

Best regards,

Ian McKie
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is our 3rd time staying in Oakwood Premier JKT, although I gave 4 stars in my earlier review (2nd stay .. great as the 1st one, wrote on the 07.01.2016) this time though, I have to give 1 star. 

As it has always been I stay here with my husband & almost 4 years old son. 
As my son played in the room, unfortunately & accidentally 2 water glasses that were on the coffee table were elbowed, fell and broken. We reported this incident on time.
Two days later, we got an unpleasant surprise, we've been charged around 12-13 EUR for these 2 glasses. Never have we experienced nor heard, that any fancy restaurants / hotels would charge their patrons for glasses / plates that were accidentally broken during the services. 
Although, we suppose, it is Oakwood's right to charge us these 2 glasses, we were disappointed that they opted to go ahead and did so. They didn't seem to consider that 1) this is the 3rd time we stay here (every time for around 2-3 weeks) and 2) the mandatory service from our total bill will be much higher than this 12-13 EUR (plus the extra tips that we left in the past exceeded this amount too).

We are not disappointed because of 12-13 EUR that were charged to us (on the contrary were the broken item was hundreds EUR, we would have understood their decision to charge us) but it is about the service & how Oakwood values their customers. Would the facts that this is not our 1st stay and that there was no inciddent in the other 2 stays before were not considered in the decision making? 
Made us wonder if Oakwood JKT is so petty that they opted to sacrifice a good relationship over 12-13 EUR? 
Does such policy (breaking & paying) is Oakwood's policy or this is limited to Oakwood's JKT's policy.

We hope that this will not happen to any other guests in the future & Oakwood JKT would value their guests over small things. 

Thank you.
title: Disappointed. 3rd time apparently is not a charm.

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent experience at Oakwood Jakarta. 
I am sorry that on this occasion you were disappointed with our service. Clearly it is our objective to meet the expectations of our guests, particularly those who have been here before. We are sorry that in this particular case we have failed. We would however like to clarify a couple of points from the property perspective. 
Firstly we do indeed have a charging policy. I would like to point out that it is a very flexible policy and that we do not automatically charge guests for broken items. We review the situation on a case by case basis and certainly do not charge in situations where there is limited accidental breakage. Secondly, under no circumstances do we charge anything without communicating with our guests and they in turn agreeing and accepting the charge.
I would like to point out that you have posted this Trip Advisor review prior to checking out of the property and while you were still communicating with us via email over the incident. Quite rightly you made your opinions about the charging known to hotel employees and requested that I was made aware of your dissatisfaction. That is exactly what happened and we waived the charges. 
Thank you once again for your feedback as it is only through opinions such as yours that we can evaluate our performance and find ways to improve. 

Best regards,

Ian McKie
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Very secure and outstanding staff. Extremely helpful when looking for shopping recommendations and advice on sightseeing.  Always a staff member at the elevators to add additional security.  Pool and exercise facilities excellent.
title: Oakwood Jakarta

owner_response.text:

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your response regarding your recent stay at Oakwood Jakarta. I am glad that you found our rooms to be nice and clean.

I am sorry that you had a issue ordering water. To be honest with you we have been unable to identify the exact problem. We do not impose any limit on the amount of water we allow and our guest directory advises customers to call our Guest Services if they want a refill. We have checked back through all our records over the past two months and we found no record of any guest being denied extra water. We get such requests pretty regularly and cannot find any reason why anyone would deny this request. I can only assume that perhaps we did not understand the request properly.
In any case I apologize that there was obviously some sort of misunderstanding.  

I hope this incident will not prevent you returning to our property for a future visit.

Best regards,

Ian McKie

text:
Stayed here for 1 night, and will only do again if I have no choice.

The reason after checking in and going to meetings and returning at 11pm I discovered that my bathroom was generating a whistling buzzing noise.  This occurred intermittently all I got up at 5:15 to catch my cab.  

On speaking to the desk in the morning they were able to describe the sound immediately but then told me it was not known.  Then I was told it only happened in rooms with long stay guests.  Or more precisely it happens in most rooms and is you stay longer you are more likely to experience it.

Therefore I can deduce the management knows of the issue, but does not see provide rooms where guests can sleep as a priority and allocates the room anyway.  To compound this I was told the room had been checked before it was allocated which to me means that housekeeping does not do their job either.
title: Rooms with known problems sold to guests

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay at Oakwood Jakarta. I am sorry that your experience with us was spoiled by the noise problems from the bathroom. Obviously we try to meet the expectations of our customers and it is disappointing to know that in this particular case we have failed. It's a shame that you did not contact one of our associates when you became aware of the problem as I feel sure we could have come up with a solution. We certainly had other rooms available and could have relocated you. 
All our rooms are checked by a housekeeping supervisor before being released as fit for sale. Clearly this is primarily a check on cleanliness and equipment but if maintenance issues are encountered they should be dealt with. Based on your feedback I will certainly ensure the checking process is robust and thorough. 
Thank you once again for your feedback as it is only through such comments that we can effectively evaluate our performance and improve accordingly. 

Best regards,

Ian McKie

text:
We stayed in the two-bedroom deluxe apartment over the weekend at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta.  

The property is conveniently located in the Kuningan area, near to JW Marriott and Ritz Carlton and a very short walk to Lotte Mall.  There is a nice cafe (Loewy), starbucks, ranch supermarket and some eateries located on property.  Cabbing anywhere is easy and inexpensive.  The traffic was light over the weekend.  Airport to Hotel was done in 40 mins.

Reservation and check-in were a breeze.  We would like to commend Rea from reservations for her exemplary service and effort in solving some issues.  The property had our room ready even though we checked-in early.

The apartment was very spacious, well-appointed, and featured high quality furnishing.  There were two bedrooms (1 king, 1 queen), two baths with l'occitane amenities, fully equipped kitchen, living and dining room, utility room with a washing machine.  This is perfect for families or a group of friends.  Breakfast was included in the rate, but we chose to skip breakfast and sleep in instead.

Overall, the stay was very comfortable, and the service was consistent and friendly.  I'm convinced that in Jakarta, staying in a high quality serviced apartment trumps staying in a hotel.
title: Excellent and High Quality Accommodation

text:
Been 3 times stayed in oakwood Jakarta, My first stay was for more than 2 weeks, the room was spacious, complete amenities, great gym, and love the location! 

The best for long stay, since they has laundry machine at your room also provide laundry powder, and no need to pay for additional laundry cost.
Breakfast menu was wonderful for me, from salad, western food, egg corner, fresh fruit, and dairy product, also great selection of coffee and tea.

The room serviced sometimes forgot to give me water bottle after they cleaned up my room, but they will come immediately and after you remind them.

will be back again for sure to Oakwood, for sure!
title: the best serviced apartment in Jakarta

title: Will go back to aokwood :)

text:
My wife, son and I lived in the serviced apartments for over a year so my comments will be about a long-term stay - although I think short-termers will find my comments useful. If you are staying long-term you can get a discounted rate, but if you leave early you will be penalized.  Also see if your organization has an agreement with Oakwood. They often have discounted rates for various organizations.

The property is about six years old and it is very clean and well maintained.  It is a five-star property.  The restaurant is on the same level as the pool.  There is also a bar located next to the pool with a small terrace.  The food at the Oakwood is reliably good.  The pool is well maintained and large, soft towels are provided.  

The staff are very friendly and if there is something you are not satisfied with all you have to do is call the front desk.  The property provides soap and toiletries for short-term guests.  Linens and towels are regularly changed.  Our serviced apartment was cleaned every day.  

Oakwood’s location is the best thing about the property.  All taxi drivers know where Oakwood is located.  There is a well-stocked Ranch supermarket on the ground floor as well as a Starbucks and Loewy which is arguably the best martini bar in Jakarta. They also have nice brunches on the weekend, but sometimes Lowey has parties that run late into the night and you can hear the beats and vibrations from the apartment. There are also several decent restaurants and fast food places on the ground floor.  There is a Century pharmacy at Oakwood.  The Bellagio is next door and there is a very good Mexican restaurant there.  Taxis are usually easy to get, but traffic around Oakwood in the late afternoon and early evening can be a nightmare.  The Ambassador Mall is a 10 minute walk. You can get pirated DVDs and clothing there. There is also a Carrefour in the basement that sells the best bread in Jakarta.  The new Lotte Avenue Mall is also a 10 minute walk and it has up-scale shopping and some good restaurants like Din Tai Fun.

If you have small kids keep in mind that SOS Medika Klinik is a 10 minute walk (or five minute run in an emergency). This is convenient for parents because dealing with traffic and a screaming child who is sick or needs stitches can be a nightmare.  With SOS, you are close to decent medical treatment without relying on a car. This is a big plus for staying at Oakwood.  Also be advised that if you come down with Dengue you can stay at Oakwood, head to SOS every morning for your IV drip, and return to your apartment rather than staying in a hospital (this strategy was implemented by yours truly).

There were a couple of annoying things about the property, and one main that makes me wonder if management thinks strategically.  Our refrigerator was too small and they would not replace it with a larger refrigerator.  We also wanted some of the furniture that was included in the apartment removed.  There were too many tables, but they would not remove the tables so we had to “store” them in one of our extra rooms.  They also charge for Internet and water bottles which is kind of tacky considering the rates they charge for rooms. Also be advised that if you break something you will have to replace it, and their prices are steep. This is probably due to the fact that they provide expensive cutlery, appliances and plates and glasses.  When we checked out they conducted an inventory and sent me an email asking me where certain items were.  They would not return my security deposit until all item were accounted.  The cleaning staff broke or damaged some of our personal kitchen items but we were not reimbursed.  I politely but firmly responded to their email that I did not know where their spatula or can opener was located.  They returned our deposit.  Also be advised that the children’s play room is inadequately equipped which is a shame because there are many families with children who stay at Oakwood. Also be advised that privacy can be an issue at Oakwood.  You will get to know the staff on a first name basis, and there might be days you don't want people to know your business.

The one main issue we had with the property was the construction next dear.  No one can blame Oakwood for the construction next door.  This is beyond the company’s control.  However, management did not properly prepare for the impact the construction would have on the pool area.  Dust and debris from the construction site soils the pool area, and construction workers like to stare at bikini-clad patrons.  My wife on several occasions had to yell at the workers and tell them to get lost.  Management made a feeble attempt to put up a green, plastic mesh to prevent rubbish and wandering eyes from polluting the pool area, but the mesh is too small and frankly we and other guests felt that Oakwood did not want to spend any money to put up an adequate screen.  I still live in Jakarta and often pass the Oakwood.  The small mesh is still standing, and the building next door is huge.  I wonder if Oakwood will put up a proper screen. The building next door will have offices and it would be a shame if people using the pool did not have any privacy. If Oakwood want to maintain their premier status they must do something about this.

Also be careful about joking with staff. When we were looking at the apartments I made a joke about our young child liking to run and make noise like most kids.  Oakwood decided to put a clause in our lease about noisy children. This was unnecessary and a poor way to commence our stay at Oakwood.

Overall, Oakwood is an excellent option even with all of its warts and issues.  My family and I would definitely stay there again.  Just be warned that premier services and location comes with a hefty monthly rate.
title: Oakwood: A wonderful five-star property with one main issue and some smaller issues

owner_response.text:
Dear Darrell,

Many thanks for your first hand review of your one year stay at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo Jakarta. It was a delight to accommodate you, your wife and your little boy. 

You have picked out many of the key attractions of our property:; our service ethic; facilities; the Mega Kuningan area and of course, the availability of the nearby SOS clinic to supplement the Oakwood’s emergency first responders and the three hospitals within 4 kilometer radius of the property.

We apologise for the inconveniences mentioned in your comments. Our intention is and always has been to focus on giving a consistent, transparent product and service to all our guests with an individually negotiated (either with the guest or the company/organisation representative) and clearly documented Agreement.
  
We have recently re-stocked our playroom with some mini spacehoppers, sit- on toys, a Little Tikes playhouse and a variety of other interactive items for the little ones.

Our aim, and part of our training philosophy is to greet all our guests (and particularly those that stay on an extended basis) by name in order to further enhance an atmosphere of home and belonging. It is not our intention to be intrusive or invade the privacy of our patrons.

The Good News - The construction project is now almost complete. The project has 95% of its glass exterior in place and Oakwood is no longer affected by the noise and dust from one year ago. However, a much fuller safety canopy has been installed over the entire pool in early 2014 to overcome the problems mentioned previously. Once the project is complete a permanent canopy will be installed over part of the pool to provide shade and privacy. 

In addition, as mentioned by a couple of recent TripAdvisor reviewers, the apartments on the Construction side are now some of the quietest bedrooms in Jakarta, following the project to install secondary glazing to ensure our guests are afforded a sound night’s sleep. 

As always, we are appreciative of all feedback and suggestions and try, wherever possible, to accommodate those requests.

Many thanks for your patronage 
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Clean,quiet,plush bed,great location.Loewy is just downstairs which is a plus.Apartments are big with fully equiped kitchen and washing machine/dryer.Much better than a hotel and without all the fuss other brands are bringing in.

Many thanks for the lovely review.

Best regards
General Manager

text:
I spent two weeks at Oakwood and it was almost sad going away! I had a nice apartment on the 7th floor, nr. 706, unfortunately not facing the big roundabout but a rear view with nothing to see but constructions going on. The room is well isolated and I couldn't hear anything from outside. Good room with a big living room and a kitchen corner, one big bedroom and bathroom.
The apartment looks very nice and clean with modern forniture. The kitchen had everything you need, oven, electric stoves, microwave, fridge, kettle, even something to steam the rice. In the leaving room there is a big flat tv, stereo, dvd. The bedroom is furnished with a big and coney bed, a desk, nice flat tv and a huge wardrobe where you also find an hairdryer and an iron set. The bathroom features a washing/drying machine and a shower (no bath tub). I really liked the toiletries provided (all from l'Occitane an Provence). On third floor there is a nice pool, facing the big roundabout. Unfortunately a big building is under contraction right next to it, so the pool is covered with a protection preventing the sun to shine onto it. On the second floor there is a gym, very well equipped. I had the breakfast included and I must say that I really liked it, good variety of regional and international food. The whole staff is very reliable and helpful, kudos to them. Having been several times at the Marriott nearby, I truly enjoyed the possibility of staying in a real apartment, cooking for myself and feeling like at home. There is a supermarket (and Starbucks) in the same building and at least 3-4 Malls at walking distance (5-600 mt).
title: Like being at home

owner_response.text:
Dear Federico Paesano

What a thorough review of our apartments - you have seemingly taken full advantage of all the touches of home which we try so hard to instill into the apartment design, fit-out and, of course, the provision of service by our wonderful associate team members.

Look forward to welcoming you back in the not too distant future.

Best regards
General Manager

owner_response.text:
Dear SunilRajR,

I have worked 33 years in this wonderful world of hospitality and it was only after I joined the Serviced Apartment niche sector of the industry that I too "discovered" the many benefits of staying in Serviced Apartments vis-a-vis hotels. I rue those decisions wherein I crammed my, then, young family into small hotel rooms when in many locations I could have opted for the Serviced Apartment choice. Larger space, refrigerators and cooking facilities for making the little ones favorite dishes, even washing machines for when the inevitable kiddie spillages or accidents happened! 

Your comments are much appreciated; and remember, with two wonderful Oakwoods on your doorstep in Bangalore - convince your business colleagues and visiting family/ friends to try out our niche serviced apartment products and service. I am sure, like you, they will come away smiling.... :-) !

Look forward to welcoming you back to Jakarta in the not too distant future.

With kind regards
Malcolm Hines
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I stayed in an apartment 2 bedroom deluxe. Obviously upgraded since I was alone and only for one night. The apartment is perfect for 4 persons consisting of two bedrooms each with king size 2-persons beds. All apartment is tastefully furnished and decorated with high quality. The living room is very big, 3-person sofa + 1 chair, 6-person dining table, flat screen TV and surround audio. Spacious well-equipped kitchen plus maid's / storage room with own toilet / shower. Internet is not always stable, but more to do with country than hotel. Electricity problem saw the hotel's generators kick in within 5 seconds. For a family of 3-4, 2 couples or 4 friends, looking for a serviced apartment, even for longer stays, I can highly recommend this. Having stayed a month with my family at the excellent Orchard Parksuites Singapore, I would rate this place even higher.
title: Excellent Hotel / Serviced Apartments in CBD

owner_response.text:
Dear Dutch Carioca,

Many thanks for taking time out to write a review and contribute some photos. Much appreciated.

As you may have read, one of Jakarta's main electricity generators was inoperable for three days; resulting in the need for our in-house generators to take over the burden. I am happy to report that they coped admirably with the outages / cutover and cutback; and that the National Grid has now restored full functionality of their plant.

The prolonged outages, as you correctly pointed out, had some impact on the Fibre Optic feed from our  Internet provider but again, stability has now returned. On that note, we are in the process of replacing our wi-fi transceivers with state of the art equipment which should further improve the in-apartment wi-fi experience.

Look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Best regards
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

Thers a washing machine in the bathroom too so no need to pay huge laundry bills for ur clothes! It even had a built in dryer, so our clothes were washed dried and redy to wear in within an hour!! :) happy days! 
Location is very good... thers so much stuff to do when u get out.
Thers a 24hour supermarket on the ground floor of hotel, so litrally everything is available on hand right away. Even groceries if u fancy cookin up a meal in ur hotel room! 
The kitchen was equiped with EVERYTHING u cud possibly need...from spoons to chopping boards to mixing bowls to pots n pans to ovan dishes... just about evrythin you would need. 

Extremly sattisfied with this hotel and would gladly stay again if we ever visited Indonesia again.

text: This apartment is more than I've ever expected. The location is perfect for bussines or shopping since it just a step away from Sudirman street, the center of business area and shopping district. If you want a middle range fashion, electronics (computer, laptop, hand phones, ect ) you can go accros the street to Ambassador mall. Or there are two other shopping mall near by if you prefer more branded goods. Outside Oakwood apt you can also find a supermarket, drug store and several restaurant (inc Starbucks) with a good quality. The staff is very polite especially the receptionist. Room was spacious, clean and nicely furnished. Breakfast was really nice and tasty too, and less crowded than if you have it in the hotel restaurant. I stayed there for two nights and wish I stayed longer. The only minus is the swimming pool area. Because of the construction of a new building next to Oakwood ( which is taller then Oakwood building ) , the swimming pool now face another building and all the construction worker can watch you swim, it was not comfortable at all. But hopefully someday Oakwood management will fixed and re new the swimming pool area. Would really recommend this apartment.
title: Apartment worthy of Five Stars

text:
I stayed at Oakwood Premier for 2 nights with my partner who was doing business in Jakarta. This hotel is of a very high standard. The apartments are enormous, nicely furnished and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. 
I was particularly impressed by the breakfast, great quality food with anything you could possibly want available! The gym was also of a very high standard.
It's hard to get around Jakarta due to the horrific traffic but there are some good food options available at your door. Lowey restaurant is at the bottom of the building and the Ritz Carlton (10 minutes walk) also has 2 lovely restaurants.
Very much enjoyed my stay here and would highly recommend this hotel.
title: High Quality Hotel

text:
We stayed for 4 months in this Apartments and everything was great. Service was very good, the rooms are clean, very comfortable and the services great (gym and pool), the only thing is they are constructing a new building just next to Oakwood so the swimming pool changed a lot.

text:
If you travel for business to Jakarta and look for a place to be for a week or 1 year, this is the place to be.  Centrally located with easy access whether To Northern part of the city or South, Oakwood is located in a small haven of Central Jakarta called Mega Kuningan.  Staff is great - like in all Indonesia - and with fast feel at home.  The best part is that you have trendy restaurants and bars at the bottom of the tower, Starbuck café and a very complete supermarket, travel agency, ATMs and hairdresser.... a luxury in Jakarta to have this at hand and not to have to drive for it!
We were here for 2 months and highly recommend it
title: The best mid-term, long term address in Jakarta

text:
Spend one night in the Oakwood because the regular hotel I used next door was fully booked. Nothing wrong with this place, but a bit high at the price .

Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Service is where it is supposed to be. However internet is not free and it does not serve breakfast. Also booking a table at the restaurant next door is something they cannot get done on a busy Friday night. Would have expected a better relationship for a high quality place and its more or less in-house place.

owner_response.text:
Dear Luxwood

Thank you for your review and I am glad you enjoyed our spacious apartments and service. We, too, enjoyed having you stay with us. I do assure you that our rates are very competitive among similar products in the vicinity. 
I am sorry to hear that you missed our buffet breakfast, which is available daily at the Oakroom on the third floor. 

As for the popular restaurant next door, I must tell you that evening (and often lunch) reservations fill up the week before. I, myself, have been unsuccessful several times and do understand your frustration. If you know you’re going to be there beforehand the next time, please let us know so we can make a reservation in advance for you. 

Best regards
General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We, a family with 2 young children aged 4 and 1, stayed in one bedroom executive (bedroom plus den) from Dec 10-17 and Dec 23-Jan 2, 2013. We loved our stay!!!! Oakwood was truly a home away from home. All staff members were courteous, helpful and sincere. The apartment was clean and spacious. It provided enough room for our kids to roam around and for us to entertain guests. The bed was very comfortable - I personally loved the duvet. Our housekeeper, Nisa, kept the apartment clean and clutter free. The swimming pool was a nice size, and I loved how the shallow area was separated from the deep end with a wall. Oakroom breakfast buffet didn't provide as wide selections as other hotels, but it was enough for us. We loved having Ranch Market (supermarket) and several restaurants on site. Truly convenient for everyday living. 

Note there's still a major construction next door. Our bedroom faced the construction site - we didn't have major noise problems during our stay even during works that were completed late at night for a few nights (Oakwood management posted notes about this all over the property - we were originally concerned this would disrupt our sleep). 

Oakwood is definitely our place of choice when we are visiting Jakarta again. Thank you Oakwooders for making our visit to Jakarta special and memorable.

Only tip: corners of the shower start to look slimy. A more thorough cleaning is needed.
title: Loved our stay!!

owner_response.text:
Babypink2412

Many thanks for your detailed compliments; I am glad we were able to make yourself and your family comfortable during your recent stay.

Ms Nisa will be commended by way of an award and certificate for her clean and clutter free mentality.

I appreciate your observation on the shower corners and we shall instigate a project to rectify that room and check all others.

Once again many thanks and look forward to accommodating you when you next visit Jakarta.

Kind regards
General Manager

text:

Only negative was a humming noise outside of building during our stay.  Not sure exactly what the noise is from ... A/C unit maybe?
title: Great stay in Jakarta!

text:
The first time I went here, I stayed for almost a month. This hotel is a like a mini-home, so it is really good for a long stay.  Its location is perfectly convenient as well. There are restaurants, supermarket and drugstore nearby.  There's also a mall across.   The price of food (even for room service) is also just right.

They just need to improve on their amenities.  Sometimes, I need to ask for soaps as they do not replenish this as regularly. And the body wash and shampoos smell masculine. Then, I think, the bedding needs some thorough cleaning because I get a few rashes.  Although i am not sure if i really got those rashes because of the bedding.. or just because the season was quite dry during my visit.

I had stayed in Oakwood twice already. And yes, I still prefer this hotel for long business trips.
title: Good for long stay

text: my husband has been in Jakarta since november 2011. Since  then he has made Oakwood his home. I and our 2 daughters joined him for a long duration stay in july 2012.we have gradually shifted from a 1 bedroom , to  2 bedroom and then to a 3 bedroom apartment in oakwood each time loving the interiors as well as the different view offered by the rooms.Once in a while we vote as a family to shift to other housing colonies with simiar or maybe better amenities.but believe me every time we all have voted in favor of oakwood!In all the 3 apartments we have lived in we have had the experience of wonderful helpers, who are true to their job,honest,and most importantly always smiling.No wonder it has been said that Indonesians are the happiest people in the world.Oakwood has been like a home awayfrom home to me and my family.My husband's office at Sudirman is close by,as also mydaughters' school.I just have to walk out of Oakwood and there is a plethora of options for me to shop at.I have come here with just a suitcaseful of clothes and have  not needed to purchase a thing for my kitchen and my daily needs.....thanx to the ever helpful staff at Oakwood....everybody needs a mention here from the men at the security to the people at the reception,the persons to assist you and help you (with your grocery at times !)near the elevators and ofcourse the excellent housekeepers who have worked tirelessly for us.......need to mention Dini,Eko and Ahmed who helped us in our apartments.Would love to recommend Oakwood to our friends coming from India.
title: home away from home!

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

text:
I have stayed at many of Jakarta's 5* hotels but recently tried the Oakwood on a recommendation. Although billed as serviced apartments, the property is run just as a 5* hotel. All the facilities are there: daily maid, room service, restaurant/bar, pool, gym and 24 hour service.

What makes Oakwood a great alternative to a hotel is the spacious rooms. I had a deluxe 1 bd apartment and it was great. Fully fitted out kitchen, lounge room with Plasma and DVD player and a separate bedroom with another big TV, The bathroom is excellent and also houses a washer/dryer if you want to do your own laundry.

The staff are very helpful. The restaurant is a bit quiet and food only OK - you're better off trying one of the number of good restaurants downstairs in the same building. There is also a well stocked supermarket downstairs selling everything you need. Broadband internet is fast but costs $15/d or $40/week.

I'd happily stay here over the Marriot next door. It might not have the buzz of a big hotel but if you want space and a great room, the Oakwood is a great choice. 

A word of warning though: The block of land next to the Oakwood is about to built on, assuming a large office or hotel. The rooms will get very noisy during construction. (august 2012).
title: Great 5* alternative to a hotel

owner_response.text:
Dear Manly-sider,

Many thanks for your review, you have captured the essence of the niche accommodation market which Oakwood intends to appeal to.

During August our restaurant offered a Buka Puasa Buffet at sunset, geared to the many companies which celebrate the "Break-fast" with their employees during the month of Ramadhan. However, in addition to this we have a cosmopolitan "a la carte" menu using the best of local and imported ingredients authentically prepared.

Your observation on a new building being constructed on the neighbouring plot is correct. Having personally met with the local authority and the site manager; we have been assured that work will occur between 8.30am and 10.00pm from Monday through Saturday. Our Security and Front Office associates monitor this and any disturbance caused by variance from this schedule is immediately reported to the Site supervisor and, so far, work suspended.

The piling is almost complete and the excavation work is due for completion by end of November 2012; whereafter the less distracting "normal" tower construction will ensue.

Once again, many thanks for your input - much appreciated.

General Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I am a Marriot Premium Level Guest and also a Starwood and Hilton Honors member.

I recently checked into Oakwood for long term stay due to the need to be in Jakarta for long term project. I found the hospitality service comparable to most 5 star but with 5 star prices. 

What is lacking in Oakwood is sensitivity?
1) Normally when checked in we pay post when we leave - Oakwood demanded 1 month deposit in advance and $300USD for food and incidentals
2) Next, they provided invoice 6 weeks in advance of due date & demanded the payment on 1st on each month.
3) Charge in US rate but at much higher exchange rate. Thus benefiting again from the exchange rate.
4) Sales staff were insensitive (as being a long term stay) i asked for an early check i.e.. 10am before a 12 noon check in, she told me they wanted extra charges or use the GYM shower!

I find Oakwood mgmt/sales office = insensitive, not tactful and pure & simply trying to "rip you off".

Location is their advantage in Kuningan
Staff courtesy for daily events at par with any 5 star hotels; not better at PAR.
Sales process & billing & sensitivity = POOR. Its all about money for them!

If you don't want to get billed before your stay I suggest avoid Oakwood.
title: Long term stay in Oakwood

owner_response.text:
Dear albertkjtan

Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to clarify some differences between serviced apartment and hotel procedures, more specifically, in invoicing policies. You see, for short-stays of less than 30 days, as with a typical hotel, the procedure is the same – we take a credit card swipe and the bill is settled upon check-out. However, for stays of 30 or more days, the system becomes one of a lease or rental agreement.

You have helped me realize that our team has to be more diligent in highlighting such terms to the guest upon the signing of the rental agreement, thank you for this.

I regret the inconvenience we have caused you and hope that the remainder of your stay is enjoyable.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Informed Oakwood about 1 week prior to my departure of my flight details and arrival time at CGK airport and quite quickly customer service replied that they have booked a Silverbird taxi for me at the airport. Even provided me with the booking number and airport layout where the taxi counters were!  Much appreciated, considering the notoriety of Jakarta taxis.

Check in went without any hassles, although it took them a while to find me an apt on the higher floors, which I had requested much earlier when I made my reservation.  They had wanted to assign an apt on a low floor, much to my dismay!  I spent the hour in the 3rd level cafe having some Indonesian sates and nasi goreng while they sorted out my room.  By the way, the main lobby was plush and reminiscent of the living room of an opulent home.  Security was tight considering they were located in the Kuningan business area near JWMarriott  – they even use full-time sniff dogs at both front and rear entrances.

What excited me in my 1 bdrm exec apt was the use of dimmer control for all the lightings, including those in the kitchen and bathroom.  I have not seen this feature being fully implemented in any other hotels or serviced apts. This not only help to save electricity costs but also provide the possibility of creating a nice soft ambience in the rooms, and also when we want only a glimmer of light, not the full strength in the toilet when we sleep.  Oakwood also provides better than average utensils and glasswares, eg. Spiegelau crystal wine glasses, Narumi fine bone china plates, Teka oven, Ariston washing machine & dryer, etc.  I find it odd, though, that the washing machine is placed inside the already smallish toilet.  I was told all 1 bdrm apts do not come with bath-tubs, which was another disappointment as I was looking forward to soaking myself in the Crabtree & Evelyn products which I brought along. I was prepared to fork out more for a 2-bdrm apt with bath-tub but was told they were running full house during the period.  Oh well.

Breakfast each morning at the level 3 restaurant was very pleasant.  This eatery was huge with many tables (separate room for smokers), and the food variety sufficient.  There was always a chef to whiff up the special omelette or sunny side.

The gym is on the smallish side but has ample machines.  The running treadmills were fully occupied when I went there twice, so I had to use the stair-climbing machine.

Another unusual and pleasant touch is that Oakwood as a serviced apt provides newspaper to my room each morning – I welcome this very much.  I have stayed in many service apts in Asia, esp Somersets, Grand Mecures, etc and I have to buy my own newspaper always.

Apparently, my room package does not include internet connectivity and it costs US$15 per day.  In this day and age, I find it rather absurd that rooms do not come with internet access.

But on the whole, my take is that this Oakwood property is much better than most serviced apts in terms of service, infrastructure and maintenance, and it helps being situated in a prime location and with ample essential outlets within the complex – a pharmacy, a high-end supermarket with a side café to order nasi goreng and steaks, several eating outlets like Penang Bistro, Pancake Parlour, Indonesian café, Starbucks, and even a Ya Kun Coffee stall.  Two front desk officers deserve special mention for outstanding and courteous service – Natan and Reza.  They took my requests seriously and were thorough in recommending a good tour agency for city and Bogor/Puncak trips.  Thanks much, guys!

I would recommend this Oakwood property to anyone without hesitation.
title: The service started even before I checked in!

text:
The property is quite new and well maintained. Service quality in terms of staff, daily cleaning and facility maintenance has been consistent throughout.  Room size may not be as generous as the other serviced apartment blocks available in Jakarta.

It is also conveniently located and the residents can find the necessary amenities in the mall downstairs and many choices of restaurants nearby.

The only things, as far as I am concerned, that someone looking to stay at Oakwood should consider are (especially for long stay):

- there is no balcony to the rooms and all the windows are sealed (perhaps for the very good safety reasons).  but the trouble is that you would not get any fresh air and will have to always live with the central air-cond system.

- the ergonomics of the furniture is poor (especially the sofa set in the living room - sorry that I am not 6-foot tall).  Fortunately, I don't really spend a lot of time watching TV and sitting on the sofa.  Otherwise, it can create back problem for me.
title: My stay at Oakwood Jakarta for over 10 months
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

text:
I've stayed at the Oakwood a couple of times in both the 1BR Executive and 1BR Deluxe over the last three or four months

I will stay here again - the place is comfortable, clean, convenient and given the extra space, good value.  Like most serviced apartments, this is just the sort of place one would like to stay for a medium to long term, rather than a single roomed hotel. 

There's places to eat nearby, a convenience store downstairs, and shopping mall(s) a short walk away.

The gym is small, and apparently can get busy at times, although when I went first thing in the morning, it was quite.

Security checks include sniffer dogs and metal detectors, although I am personally cynical about the effectiveness of such inspections.

There is construction in the vicinity, and I understand from colleagues who stayed for several months earlier this year that there can be noise from the construction activity.  I didn't experience this personally - but maybe a room on the other side of the building might be best.

Internet access is wireless and cable and I have no complaints about speed and wireless coverage.  However, I did experience outage for an hour or so due to some internet infrastructure problems at the hotel.

Subject to room availability, I expect to  back in a few weeks.  My  stays are usually short, and rooms at the Oakwood have not always been available when I've travelled to JKT in the past.
title: Will Stay Again
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

text: I stayed at Oakwood Premier in Jakarta for 3 months. From top to bottom this place is way ahead of all the places I have stayed in my global travels in terms of friendliness/helpfulness of the staff, cleaniness of the apartments, excellent service, good facilities and in a prime location.
title: Setting the Standard in Serviced Apartments

text: I must admit that I first chose Oakwood in Mega Kuningan for its proximity to my Jakarta office location. However, now I will always use Oakwood when I have a choice. The first thing that struck me was the low-key environment. It is very pleasant, professional but a little understated i.e. unlike those 5-star hotels that have overly elaborate lobbies etc. And, when I went into my apartment, I was really pleasantly surprised. The furnishing is very tastefully put together and, in the words of one of my business colleague, "If I were to put it together myself, that's exactly what I would have done". The bed was very nice with many pillows. Even the kitchen is better equiped than my own at home! The staff provided excellent service without being too overbearing. Overall, I rate it as one of the best locations I have been. Nowadays, I look forward to my trip to Jakarta because of Oakwood itself. However, the price seems to have gone up lately but perhaps that's something in tandem with the other 5-star facilities cashing in on the strong Indonesian economy.
title: I will always choos Oakwood when possible ...
partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

text:
I stayed at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo on my first trip to Indonesia and loved it. The standard of service is very high and everyone is always willing to help. The apartment was stunning - pure luxury. Everything is modern and very well maintained. The kitchen was also stocked with all the bits and pieces you need to make yourself a quick meal or a feast. 

The location of the hotel was pretty good - it was a short walk to the ITC and Ambassador Mall. Both are worth a look. The ITC is really like a multi-level market inside a building (think the MBK in Bangkok but lower quality goods with minimal to no negotiation). It has your usual DVDs, phones and a variety of clothing. The Ambassador is slightly better and a bit more organised than the ITC... but don't expect any awesome bargains. Directly across from the hotel there is also another mall - I forgot what it is called though. It has more places to eat and shop.

Given Jakarta isn't really a tourist destination, the setup of the block the hotel sits on is pretty good. Directly downstairs there is a pretty good selection of places that will keep you in your comfort zone - there is a very well stocked supermarket, Starbucks, Pancake Parlour, other coffee joints, a chemist, and two restaurants (from memory).
title: Luxury within a busy city

photos.caption: Lounge area of the first apartment

All the staff at the hotel - including Security - is always going the extra mile to make sure you have a great stay. I can really recommend this place for anyone staying in Jakarta for a while. 
The restaurant at the hotel is also great. I also enjoy the Mega Kuningan area - with many great Choices for Food and drinks.

text:
Spotless Apartment Hotel. We stayed as a family of 4 in a 3 bedroom unit. Very well stocked Crockery and cutlery section. Small but functional lounge area, and very comfortable king sized beds and pillows. Nice decent sized pool  for exercise and also a big shallow area for kids. Kids could also use a playroom. good gym with decent selection of equipment.
Hotel located above a small selection of quality shops and restaurants. A small supermarket"Ranch Market" with a good selection if you want to self cater. Lots of good restaurants  in this area and cafes including a "Starbucks." The actual Hotel restaurant had a small buffet which was rather uninspiring. We never ate there for lunch or dinner due to tall the great restauarants underneath.
The reason I had to write this review was the amazing honesty of the staff. A small team of workers would clean the apartment thoroughly every day. I saw an email 2 weeks after our stay in my junk inbox and wasn't sure whether to open it. In a rather crytpic way, the manager asked if I had forgotten anything, particularly from the safe. Lo and behold,after a phone call to clarify, one of the cleaners had found a jewellery box with probably thousands of dollars of jewellery inside and handed it in!
We couldn;t be more grateful about this and management refused to accept any monetary gifts or physical gifts from us to thank them for their tremendous honesty. Absolutely Amazing. and recommend highly.
title: very comfortable Hotel, Unbelievable honesty

partner_attribution: Ulasan dikumpulkan dalam kemitraan dengan Oakwood

text:
I stayed in Jakarta twice in the last few months, once at the Le Meridien, then at the Oakwood Premier Cozmo and what a difference. Oakwood apartments are huge, modern and well fit out with a kitchen, laundry facilities and very comfortable bed and furnishings. The room service food was great, and there is a Starbucks and a supermarket on the ground floor. Transport in and out is much easier than the other 5 star hotels as they are on a large road. Traffic is a big consideration in Jakarta, here is some other advice to help:
1. When u land and want visa on arrival, you can pay 250000 rupiah, Or US$25 to get it, you will need to arrive with cash, no ATM when u land
2. When u depart it is US$15 tax to be paid at the check in counter
3. Check in counters are past security not before like every other airport
4. Taxis can be unsafe, only book Silver Bird or if on a budget Blue Bird, but those drivers don't have great English so take instructions in Indonesian
5. Traffic in Jakarta is awful, worstnin the world that I have experienced and I go to India often. You will travel on average 8km an hour in peak time (7-10 and 4-8) but don't be tempted to walk, it isn't safe, so just try to arrive or depart outside those times.
6. Last advise is definitely choose the Oakwood Premier Cozmo, it really is an oasis in the city. Not only are the rooms and surrounding facilities fabulous, it also had a lovely pool to relax at should u get good weather!

Happy travels!
title: So much better than a 5 star hotel

text: Located in the relatively quiet Mega Kuningan area of Jakarta, staying at the Oakwood has been a very pleasant home-from-home experience.  The rooms are spacious, clean and homely... fully loaded with everything you might need.
